lexicon

Class Lexicon

  • java.lang.Object
    • lexicon.Lexicon

  • public class Lexicon
extends java.lang.Object
    Used by the decision making agent to select a word from a list of possibilities, the lexicon generates a list of candidate words, along with a frequency of use, when presented with an incomplete word or list of words. Words are pulled from a pre-existing mySQL database that is loaded from a specified address. The lexicon also updates the frequency of use of a specific word in the aforementioned database when the word is chosen as the best candidate by the decision making agent.
    Author:
    Nathan Van Dyken

    • Field Detail

      • conn

        java.sql.Connection conn
        The connection to the mySQL database. It is opened in the private loadDB method and is closed when the object is destroyed.

        public Lexicon()

    • Method Detail

      • loadDB

        public void loadDB()
        Establishes the connection with the SQL database.

      • getMatches

        public java.util.ArrayList<PossibleWord> getMatches(java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> candidates)
        Called by the decision making agent; accepts a list of candidate partial-words and returns complete words that are possibly the words that the user attempted to write.
        Parameters:
        candidates - - an ArrayList of the candidate Strings to be evaluated, with the unknown characters replaced with underscore characters ('_'). "Unknown characters" refer to characters that have a level of confidence that falls below a certain level of tolerance, specified in the decision making agent.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of possible words with a frequency of use for each word.

      • getMatches

        public PossibleWord[] getMatches(java.lang.String[] candidates)
        Same as Lexicon.getMatches(ArrayList<String> candidates), except that it accepts and returns arrays as opposed to ArrayLists.
        Parameters:
        candidates - - an array of the candidate Strings to be evaluated, with the unknown characters replaced with underscore characters ('_'). "Unknown characters" refer to characters that have a level of confidence that falls below a certain level of tolerance, specified in the decision making agent.
        Returns:
        an array of possible words with a frequency of use for each word.

      • useWord

        public void useWord(java.lang.String newWord)
             throws InvalidWordException
        Updates the database to reflect the use of the specified word. If the word does not exist in the DB, a record is created and the frequency of use of the word is initialized to one. Else, if the word does exist, the frequency of use of the word is incremented by one.
        Parameters:
        newWord - - the word for which the frequency of use should be updated.
        Throws:
        InvalidWordException - - thrown if word is in an improper form; used to safeguard the DB.

      • finalize

        public void finalize()
        Called when the object is destroyed. Only functions to close to the connection to the MySQL database.
        Overrides:
        finalize in class java.lang.Object
